Detailed Description

TREX reactors and messaging types.

This module offers all the utilities to help define and implements new reactors. It also defines goals and observations excahnged between reactor as the abstract definition of a clock. All of these are provided by the library lib/libTREXteransaction.

Usually plug-ins are based on this library and can then defines new reactors, observations, goals or clocks.

Author:
Conor McGann & Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Typedef Documentation

typedef utils::list_set<client_id_traits> client_set

Set of clients.

This type is usded to store and maintin the set of client to a timeline. The clients of a timline are the reactors that declared it as external

timeline

Definition at line 164 of file TeleoReactor_fwd.hh.

typedef utils::list_set<pending_traits> external_set

external timelines

The type used by a TeleoReactor to maintin and manage the set of all its External relation

Most of this management is done by the external class that acts as an iterator other this type with extra functionalities

See also:
class external

Definition at line 48 of file external.hh.

typedef boost::shared_ptr<Goal> goal_id

A goal identifier.

This is the type used by TREX to identify and manipulate goals

Goal

Definition at line 265 of file Goal.hh.

typedef std::list<goal_id> goal_queue

A goal queue.

The basic container used by external class to maintain and process the set of goals being posted by a reactor and yet to be dipatched to the owner of this timeline

external

Definition at line 26 of file external.hh.

typedef utils::map_id_traits< Relation, goal_queue > pending_traits

A external timeline proxy.

This type by a external class to represent an external timeline relation and its corresponding set of pending goals

external

TREX::transaction::graph const &  g 
) [related, inherited]

Reactor adjacency vertices of a reactor.

Parameters:
[in] r A reactor
[in] g A graph

Gives all the relations reflecting the external timelines of the reactor r. This method is very similar to out_edges except that the relation are represented differently.

) [related, inherited]

target of a relation

Parameters:
[in] rel A relation
[in] g A graph

Gives the reactors that this relation connect to. This reactor is the one that declared the corresponding timeline as Internal

Returns:
The reactor which is the client of this relation or TREX::transaction::graph::null_reactor() if the relation is not active
